sources.data_found: 10 new GPU nodes on chip: Eight LS40S nodes and two H100 nodes, adding 320 CPU cores and 36 GPUs. [Note: 8 L40S nodes + 2 H100 nodes = 10 nodes total]
12 new GPU nodes on chip: 10 LS40S nodes and two H100 nodes, adding 320 CPU cores and 44 GPU Cards.
HPCF2018: 1 GPU node containing 4 NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPUs connected by NVLink and 2 Intel Skylake CPUs
Ada cluster: Four machines have 8x Nvidia RTX 2080 Ti GPUs (11GB each). Seven machines have 8x Nvidia Quadro RTX 6000 GPUs (24GB each). Two machines have 8x Nvidia Quadro RTX 8000 GPUs (48GB each).
COEIT (College of Engineering and IT) Fall 2025: 4,655 undergraduate enrollment; 1,063 graduate enrollment (MS programs); 335 PhD enrollment
In 2023, Computer Science awarded 151 Masters degrees. Computer and Information Sciences and Support Services total: 981 degrees awarded.

student_data.notes: CSEE Fast Facts reports Fall 2023 enrollment of 2299 undergraduate and 1272 graduate students total across CS and EE. Using typical CS/EE split from COEIT databook and datausa.io degree completions showing CS as dominant program, estimated CS undergrad ~1800 (78% of total). Graduate CS estimated as ~600 MS students based on MS degree completions of 151/year × 2 year program × 2 (accounting for part-time students). PhD estimated at 150 based on COEIT PhD total of 335 and CS being ~45% of doctoral programs. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Ada cluster: 4 nodes × 8 GPUs = 32 RTX 2080 Ti
HPCF2013 cluster: 18 nodes × 2 GPUs = 36 K20 (noted as shut down in August 2023)

gpu_resources.notes:
CALCULATIONS:

1) Chip cluster (2025 deployment):
   - H100: 2 nodes × 4 GPUs/node = 8 H100 (assuming typical 4-GPU config)
   - L40S: Multiple sources conflict - one says '8 L40S nodes, 36 GPUs' suggesting 36/8 ≈ 4.5 GPUs/node, another says '10 L40S nodes, 44 GPU Cards total'. Using conservative estimate: 36 L40S GPUs total

2) Ada cluster (operational):
   - RTX 6000: 7 nodes × 8 GPUs = 56 Quadro RTX 6000
   - RTX 2080 Ti: 4 nodes × 8 GPUs = 32 (listed in other_high_vram_gpus)
   - RTX 8000: 2 nodes × 8 GPUs = 16 (listed in other_high_vram_gpus)

3) HPCF2018 (taki cluster):
   - V100: 1 node × 4 GPUs = 4 Tesla V100

4) Older systems:
   - K20 GPUs from HPCF2013 were shut down August 2023

TOTAL HIGH-VRAM GPUs (≥24GB): H100 (8) + L40S (36) + RTX 6000 (56) + V100 (4) + RTX 8000 (16) = 120

analysis_notes: UMBC has recently upgraded their HPC infrastructure with new H100 and L40S nodes in 2025. The ada cluster provides significant GPU resources with RTX 6000/8000 GPUs. Student enrollment data shows strong CS program with ~2550 total CS students estimated across all levels.
